column3: Please modify the commit message to actually explain the changes.
i'm not sure if @shoryak is still watching bitcoin core stuff since the semester is quite busy and this was a SoB project...\n\ni think it'd be fine to merge as is?

That's a valid reason to no longer work on it, but "author doesn't have time" is not a valid reason for something to be merged while ignoring reviewer comments. Normally we'd close and label "up for grabs".\n\nBut in this particular case, yes, it's probably fine like this. @theStack do you agree?
@laanwj: My concerns were mainly considering aesthetics (commit message formatting etc.), but the code change itself looks correct to me, so yes, I agree üëç
on line 59 above, should Available also be made a reference? Otherwise the modifications to the coin would not be recorded since it's a copy?

Oops My bad  , yes Available needs to be a reference , fixing it changes the benchmark results substantially . 

|               ns/op |                op/s |    err% |     total | benchmark
|--------------------:|--------------------:|--------:|----------:|:----------
|    1,103,652,315.00 |                0.91 |    2.6% |     13.34 | `ComplexMemPool`
